A recently widowed man's son calls a radio talk-show in an attempt to find his father a partner." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0108160/","name":"Sleepless in Seattle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWY1MDJkZGUtZTE2OS00ODZiLTlmNzQtMDZjNzM2ZjkwM2QxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000212/","name":"Meg Ryan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0539678/","name":"Ross Malinger"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001188/","name":"Nora Ephron"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0033578/","name":"Jeff Arch","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001188/","name":"Nora Ephron","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911486/","name":"David S. Ward"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi727367449","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWVkYjM2MjAtYzY1ZC00MDE4LThjZTQtOGRkYjYzMDdkZTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWVkYjM2MjAtYzY1ZC00MDE4LThjZTQtOGRkYjYzMDdkZTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","datePublished":"1993-06-25","description":"A recently widowed man's son calls a radio talk-show in an attempt to find his father a partner.","keywords":"radio show,seattle washington,colleague,diner,waitress","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0108160/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"slightlymad22","dateCreated":"2015-02-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"I Love It","reviewBody":"I will not lie to you, I will admit right from the off that I am biased. I love this movie.

Plot In A Paragraph: Eighteen months after losing his wife, Sam (Tom Hanks) is still grieving and can't sleep. His eight year old son Jonah (Ross Malinger) misses his mother, but he wants his father to get a new wife despite Sam having not even contemplated dating again. On Christmas Eve, Jonah calls a national radio talk show and ask for a "new wife" for his Dad. Sam ends up pouring his heart out about his magical and perfect marriage to his late wife, and how much he still misses her. Among the many women who hear Sam's story and fall in love with him solely because of it is Annie Reed (Meg Ryan) a Baltimore-based newspaper writer. Who is drawn to Jim based on his story, despite already being engaged to Walter (Bill Pullman) 

1993 was a massive year for Tom Hanks with both this movie and "Philadelphia" being huge hits. Both are very different, but are equally brilliant. As is Hanks. He is heartbreakingly excellent as the widower. Amazingly the role of Annie was originally offered to Julia Roberts, who turned it down. Kim Basinger also turned it down because she thought the premise was ridiculous (Good move Kim!!) After Michelle Pfeiffer, Jennifer Jason Leigh and Jodie Foster all declined as well, Meg Ryan landed the role. I surprised this role was not wrote with Ryan in mind as this type of role was her bread and butter back then. She was perfect for this type of role. 

Rosie O Donnell is solid support to Ryan as is Bill Pullman, and Ross Malinger manages to avoid all the cliché's of most chicks actors! 

Well directed, with a sharp and witty script. I will add I also liked the fact that they didn't feel the need to make the Bill Pullman character a jerk (as is usual the case with his type of role in romantic comedies) 

One of my favourite Tom Hanks movies, one of my favourite Meg Ryan movies and one of my favourite romantic comedies. I don't own many romantic comedies. But this one is in my collection.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":163709,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"duration":"PT1H45M"</script><metacontent="

But the being takes a liking to Earth and decides to protect it.","keywords":"anti hero,marvel comics,thin attractive woman,tattooed trash,pretty legs","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1270797/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic"},"dateCreated":"2018-11-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"This film would have been much better if it wasn't for the bad writing.","reviewBody":"You would think one of the 5 (why?) writers could have gotten this right. Tom Hardy was amazing, the directing excellent, cinematography on point, V/SFX not bad, but the story was very loose and had plot and pacing issues. Venom's voice was also annoying. You would think the producers would have hired better writers instead of pathetically paying for almost every review on here 9 and above being fake (pretty much only film reviewed). I may have given this film a 7 or 8 out of 10, but only gets a 6 for the fake reviews. For me it could have been much better and deserving of the 9's and 10's had the writing been tighter. Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"datePublished":"2008-08-12","description":"Agent Neil Shaw is called out of retirement and finds himself in the midst of a plot to assassinate several leading Senators with himself set-up to take the rap for a recent killing.","keywords":"murder,corruption,betrayal,die hard scenario,martial arts training","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1233571/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"homecoming8"},"dateCreated":"2008-10-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Wesley Snipes Means No Budget These Days...","reviewBody":"Wesley Snipes is to this day still a qualified action-star, movies like Passenger 57, Murder at 1600 and the Blade Trilogy made him great. The Art Of War was also a decent action-flick which co-starred Michael Biehn(Terminator, Aliens, The Abyss). On the action-level, it certainly delivered with a great twist at the end (and some good action as well).

Art of War II co-stars Lochlyn Munroe, a comedy actor who has had some excellent roles in "Dead Man On Campus" and "Scary Movie". The story has nothing to do with the original, so it was purely a marketing-trick. Think of this as Snipes' former direct-to-DVD movies (Steven Seagal has some of these too) so the budget is limited, just like the acting, the story and so on. Like Seagal, Snipes is also years away from his glory-days. And you can tell.. A dull story, bad camera-work, lame characters and so on. 

You can skip this one, even if you love action-films. I still haven't seen The Marksman with Wesley Snipes, but judging by this painful mess, I am not going to bother. Watch Passenger 57 once again instead..","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3646,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.3},"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

and a host of dangers that can only be stopped by finishing the game.","keywords":"board game,adventurer,fight,game,year 1995","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113497/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lee_eisenberg"},"dateCreated":"2005-10-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"I guess that life is a game of chance!","reviewBody":"You know the drill: young Alan Parrish gets sucked into a board game called Jumanji, returns when a brother and sister are playing 26 years later, and has to battle the animals that wreak havoc on the town. It all seems pretty simple, but they play some neat tricks with it in the movie. As the adult Alan, Robin Williams is more subdued than usual, but still makes the character admirable. With good support from Bonnie Hunt, Kirsten Dunst, David Alan Grier, Bebe Neuwirth, Jonathan Hyde and Patricia Clarkson, this is a pretty interesting movie. I will admit that the monkeys looked pretty fake, but we can't dwell on that in this movie; the point is to enjoy oneself while watching it.\n\nOh and one more thing: from "Jumanji", I learned the difference between alligators and crocodiles.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":315706,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
A Knight's Tale: Directed by Brian Helgeland. With Heath Ledger, Rufus Sewell, Shannyn Sossamon, Paul Bettany. After his master dies, a peasant squire, fueled by his desire for food and glory, creates a new identity for himself as a knight." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0183790/","name":"A Knight's Tale","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTE5OTE4OTE2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDkzMTQ3._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005132/","name":"Heath Ledger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004692/","name":"Mark Addy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001722/","name":"Rufus Sewell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001338/","name":"Brian Helgeland"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035535/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031304/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001338/","name":"Brian Helgeland"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Knight's Tale","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2427715865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDkxMzRmODYtOTRmMy00ZjQwLTk4MjAtNDQ5YjQ2NTZjZDgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDkxMzRmODYtOTRmMy00ZjQwLTk4MjAtNDQ5YjQ2NTZjZDgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"datePublished":"2001-10-24","description":"After his master dies, a peasant squire, fueled by his desire for food and glory, creates a new identity for himself as a knight.","keywords":"medieval times,knight,jousting,london england,chaucer","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0183790/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"alancrennell"},"dateCreated":"2004-08-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"If you want to watch a serious film, don't watch this!","reviewBody":"Totally unbelievable. 

Chronologically, historically and geographically incorrect.

Full of innumerable inaccuracies and made up of a cast who talk as though they are not from the same continent, let alone the same country! What more can I say?

I tell you what I can say, I thoroughly enjoyed it!!! I laughed from beginning to end and was enraptured by the sense of friendship that these people displayed.

I only wish we could all be like them!

I loved it."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":174938,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"duration":"PT2H12M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Predestination

programme.desc:
Predestination: Directed by Michael Spierig, Peter Spierig. With Ethan Hawke, Sarah Snook, Christopher Kirby, Christopher Sommers. For his final assignment, a top temporal agent must pursue the one criminal that has eluded him throughout time. The chase turns into a unique, surprising and mind-bending exploration of love, fate, identity and time travel taboos." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2397535/","name":"Predestination","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAzODc3NjU1NzNeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDk5NTQ4NTMx._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000160/","name":"Ethan Hawke"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3512758/","name":"Sarah Snook"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852965/","name":"Noah Taylor"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294961/","name":"Michael Spierig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294962/","name":"Peter Spierig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0234956/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0311163/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0380601/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294961/","name":"Michael Spierig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1294962/","name":"Peter Spierig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0374423/","name":"Robert A. Heinlein"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi100904729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzMTIzNzYyNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTQwMDE0MzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzMTIzNzYyNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTQwMDE0MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Temporal Agent is sent on an intricate series of time-travel journeys designed to ensure the continuation of his law enforcement career for eternity. Now, on his final assignment, he must pursue the one criminal that has eluded him throughout time."},"datePublished":"2014-08-28","description":"For his final assignment, a top temporal agent must pursue the one criminal that has eluded him throughout time. The chase turns into a unique, surprising and mind-bending exploration of love, fate, identity and time travel taboos.","keywords":"time travel,temporal agent,time machine,time paradox,in love with oneself","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2397535/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Riona33"},"dateCreated":"2014-09-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"absolutely entertaining and clever!","reviewBody":"Sadly I had to travel to an old and tiny cinema to see this movie as it didn't play in the major cinemas on the Gold Coast...after watching this movie i have absolutely no clue why.

I truly enjoyed every minute of this film, all of the actors did a great job, especially Ethan Hawk. I did see some of the plot lines coming and still got a bit of a surprise in how they delivered those plot lines...if you get a chance and like a sci-fi with brains then go and watch this!!!

I would definitely not compare it to looper (just to add to the end) yes looper and predestination are about time travel, but thats were it ends... :)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":259447,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

But the being takes a liking to Earth and decides to protect it.","keywords":"anti hero,marvel comics,thin attractive woman,tattooed trash,pretty legs","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1270797/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic"},"dateCreated":"2018-11-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"This film would have been much better if it wasn't for the bad writing.","reviewBody":"You would think one of the 5 (why?) writers could have gotten this right. Tom Hardy was amazing, the directing excellent, cinematography on point, V/SFX not bad, but the story was very loose and had plot and pacing issues. Venom's voice was also annoying. You would think the producers would have hired better writers instead of pathetically paying for almost every review on here 9 and above being fake (pretty much only film reviewed). I may have given this film a 7 or 8 out of 10, but only gets a 6 for the fake reviews. For me it could have been much better and deserving of the 9's and 10's had the writing been tighter. Nevertheless, still enjoyable, but sadly only a 6/10 from me, mainly for the fake reviews that piss me off.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":380279,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

Ray Donovan, a professional "fixer" for the rich and famous in Los Angeles, can make anyone's problems disappear except those created by his own family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2249007/","name":"Ray Donovan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWY1MTE2MmItNzQyNi00YThjLWE4ZDctMDA0ZGE3OWJhYTMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTA3MTMyOTk@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000630/","name":"Liev Schreiber","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0550371/","name":"Eddie Marsan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005231/","name":"Dash Mihok"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093837/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0085751/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0081189/","name":"Ann Biderman"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 7 Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2778578713","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGVhY2M3OGYtYjRjOS00MmFjLWFlNTItOWFlOThlMmZjOTRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGVhY2M3OGYtYjRjOS00MmFjLWFlNTItOWFlOThlMmZjOTRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"While Ray makes personal progress, there are dangers that require the Ray Donovan of old. Between the NYC mayor, an unrelenting NYPD officer and clients old and new, Ray struggles to find a balance between fixing for clients and fixing himself. Premieres November 17 at 8/7c. Starring Liev Schreiber and Jon Voight.","datePublished":"2013-06-18","description":"Ray Donovan, a professional "fixer" for the rich and famous in Los Angeles, can make anyone's problems disappear except those created by his own family.","keywords":"female investigator,nudity,fixer,fbi agent,brother sister relationship","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2249007/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"TakeUpReel","dateCreated":"2020-07-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Ray Donovan Drinking Game...","reviewBody":"Take a shot if a character says:


* What?
* Sure
* It doesn't matter
* Get in the car


If you really want to raise the stakes, take a half shot every time a character says:


* F. you
* Go F. yourself


You may want to have medical professionals standing by for the last two.

This show started off great. It got boring during the middle seasons, but season 6 was very good. I have mixed emotions about season 7. They provided a lot of interesting back story for a few characters, but they left a lot of loose threads at the end.

The whole series showed way too much of Ray's daughter. She got somewhat interesting in Season 6, but then I, once again, lost interest in her during season 7.

I'm glad Ray's son wasn't shown much during the last few seasons. He was an annoying character from the beginning.

Overall, it's a good show if you can stick with the boring bits.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":78699,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3</script><metacontent="

band,guitar,drummer","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5816374/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SnoopyStyle"},"dateCreated":"2017-11-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"interesting couple","reviewBody":"Anna (Zoe Lister-Jones) and Ben (Adam Pally) are a couple fighting about everything. They are struggling. She suggests turning their fights into songs. They start a garage band with their sex-addict neighbor Dave (Fred Armisen).

Anna and Ben have some fun back and forth with Hitler jokes. I don't particularly like anybody else nor do I truly hate any of them. It's a lot of quirky hipster Hollywood and not necessarily that funny. It's especially true for Fred Armisen. He's trying too hard for my taste. I also don't like the songs. I struggle with that whole side of the movie.

I like Zoe and Adam. The movie hints quite forcefully early on about a great lost. It's revealed later on but an earlier reveal would have been better. It's not that shocking and it hung over the movie for the first half. Once revealed, the relationship has some terrific emotional scenes. There is something in this pairing but the surrounding elements don't always work.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5249,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Rock the Kasbah: Directed by Barry Levinson. With Bill Murray, Bruce Willis, Kate Hudson, Zooey Deschanel. Star."},"datePublished":"2015-10-23","description":"A down-on-his-luck music manager discovers a teenage girl with an extraordinary voice while on a music tour in Afghanistan and takes her to Kabul to america","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3164256/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cosmo_tiger"},"dateCreated":"2016-01-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"I really enjoyed and I highly recommend this. If you liked Good Morning Vietnam you will love this one as well.","reviewBody":""From the moment you heard me sing. Since you found me in the cave. Since we were put here on the Earth. Everything in our lives has led us to this time, this place." Richie Lanz (Murray) is a music manager who has fallen on tough times. When he decides to take his client to Afghanistan on tour she freaks out and disappears. Unsure of what to do he thinks his prayers are answered when he hears someone singing in a cave. He really thinks she has the talent to win the Afghan Star singing competition but is hampered by the traditions of the country. This is a great movie. Just flat out great. Not only is Bill Murray good (as always) but the music is great as well. The best way to describe this is a music centered version of Good Morning Vietnam. Funny and smart with a serious topic all holding it together. This is a movie that I really enjoyed and I recommend highly. Overall, if you liked Good Morning Vietnam you will love this one as well. I give it an A-.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11134,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Rock The Kasbah
programme.desc: Doświadczony menadżer gwiazd rocka, Richie Lanz (Bill Murray), zabiera jedną ze swoich klientek na tournee po Afganistanie. Niestety, nic nie idzie zgodnie z planem. W Kabulu Richie zostaje bez pieniędzy i paszportu. Szczęście jednak w końcu uśmiecha się do niego, gdy spotyka Salimę (Leem Lubany), młodą dziewczynę o niezwykłym głosie. Zawodowy instynkt nakazuje mu utorować artystce drogę do sławy. Namawia jej menadżera, Daoud (Beejan Land), aby jego podopieczna wystąpiła w wielkim telewizyjnym talent show. Obraz Barry'ego Levinsona ("Rain Man", "Good Morning, Vietnam", "Fakty i akty", "Uśpieni") powinien spodobać się fanom brytyjskiego humoru. Przedstawiona w filmie historia jest luźną adaptacją filmu dokumentalnego "Afghan Star" z 2009 roku.

couple","reviewBody":"Anna (Zoe Lister-Jones) and Ben (Adam Pally) are a couple fighting about everything. They are struggling. She suggests turning their fights into songs. They start a garage band with their sex-addict neighbor Dave (Fred Armisen).

Anna and Ben have some fun back and forth with Hitler jokes. I don't particularly like anybody else nor do I truly hate any of them. It's a lot of quirky hipster Hollywood and not necessarily that funny. It's especially true for Fred Armisen. He's trying too hard for my taste. I also don't like the songs. I struggle with that whole side of the movie.

I like Zoe and Adam. The movie hints quite forcefully early on about a great lost. It's revealed later on but an earlier reveal would have been better. It's not that shocking and it hung over the movie for the first half. Once revealed, the relationship has some terrific emotional scenes. There is something in this pairing but the surrounding elements don't always work.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5249,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Rock The Kasbah
programme.desc: Doświadczony menadżer gwiazd rocka, Richie Lanz (Bill Murray), zabiera jedną ze swoich klientek na tournee po Afganistanie. Niestety, nic nie idzie zgodnie z planem. W Kabulu Richie zostaje bez pieniędzy i paszportu. Szczęście jednak w końcu uśmiecha się do niego, gdy spotyka Salimę (Leem Lubany), młodą dziewczynę o niezwykłym głosie. Zawodowy instynkt nakazuje mu utorować artystce drogę do sławy. Namawia jej menadżera, Daoud (Beejan Land), aby jego podopieczna wystąpiła w wielkim telewizyjnym talent show. Obraz Barry'ego Levinsona ("Rain Man", "Good Morning, Vietnam", "Fakty i akty", "Uśpieni") powinien spodobać się fanom brytyjskiego humoru. Przedstawiona w filmie historia jest luźną adaptacją filmu dokumentalnego "Afghan Star" z 2009 roku.
